description:
**Tool Overview**:

The `sfc /scannow` command is a built-in utility in Windows that scans the integrity of all protected system files and replaces incorrect versions with correct Microsoft versions.

**Details**:

This command is typically utilized for troubleshooting and resolving issues related to system file corruption. The process works by checking the file system for any discrepancies with the files originally installed by Windows. If any issues are detected, `sfc /scannow` will attempt to repair them automatically. It is an essential step in maintaining system integrity and is often recommended when users face critical errors or instabilities in Windows.

To run this command, you need to execute it from an elevated Command Prompt. Simply type `sfc /scannow` and hit Enter. The scan may take some time depending on the size and state of your file system.
